author: Dominik Tilman
title: 60-Day Online Marketing Campaign
description: Low awareness of Catalyst among entrepreneurs outside our community, and thus a lot of untapped potential for Cardano development

assessments.note: It is a good idea how to make cardano more known, and thus to increase number of proposals, but Ads can be blocked, filtered and skipped. So the outcome does not have to be that positive as expected.
assessments.reply: The Assessor 54 misunderstand how online ads work. In this case we only pay per click, so for the outcome of the campagne it does not matter if ads are skipped or blocked, etc.

assessments.note: This proposal is aligned with the challenge objective, is presented with a very well structure project with clear targets and appropriate timelines. The proposal takes in consideration the next steps after the first contact through the marketing campaign, the concept behind the landing page I consider appropriate. The entire catalyst community and ultimately the Cardano community will benefit from the successful implementation of this proposal. The result of the implementation of this proposal can give us key information that allows us to make decisions as a community to improve the on boarding experience of new entrepreneurs. To improve this proposal I would suggest the inclusion of content that promotes or reinforces "Catalyst" as a brand. That the new members understand that this is not just a funding opportunity, but rather a new way to add value to the world.

The proposal is well written and the team behind seems to be hard at work at succeeding. Maybe the key message for the campaign could be changed from " Up to 15M$ every 6 weeks for different challenges", so as not to send out the wrong message? People who join Catalyst don't join for the money, but for the funding of new, competitive projects that would benefit the entire community.
assessments.reply: The comment "very well written" and only given a score of 3 doesn't match

assessments.note: I think one of the reasons why there are not more activity on Catalyst is that very few people know about it. The platform and decentralized nature is actually amazing, but more people need to hear about it. I think a lot of people ended up here kind of randomly. An ad campaign targetting entrepreneurs, both blockchain savvy and those with ideas that would benefit from blockchain (like I was when I found Catalyst) would be very useful for attracting more people.
An online marketing campaign has surely the possibility to impact in a positive manner outreach for future proposers
Team is looking very good and suitable for the job. I have visited their links, and I personally like the page design, so I have trust that they can deliver high quality ads.

It is a bit strange for me that the consulting company website for which he currently work is not working http://www.msi-partner.com/ and also he is the only employee registered in this company on Linkedin, It's not clear to me, but he might be the founder. Likewise, a second company appears on its Linkedin page, of which it mentions if it was a founder called "IMOVA", this company does not exist in linkedin and does not have an associated website. In his profile webpage he says that he has been part of many companies but this is not shown in the LinkedIn profile. Strange. The two teammates have full time jobs. So you can infer that they will not be 100% dedicated to the project.
assessments.reply: This review contains 3 misstatements: First, my website is as described in the proposal www.dominiktilman.com - and it works. Second, I was a co-founder of Imova, but as it says in Linkedin, this company no longer exists. Third, the team members are either freelancers or have the capacity to give 100% to the implementation of the proposal.

assessments.note: The team's experience in online marketing campaigns is quite clear, not only from their CVs, but they have also laid out a detailed plan proving that they are familiar with the costs and the process.

It seems reasonable based on the budget. The team looks committed and ready to do this when they get the funding. Targeting an audience that already know about blockchain seems easy, there are a lot of crypto youtubers for example. And then they can put the ad on more general entrepreneurial channels to attract people from the second group.
The plan is very detailed and the experience relevant to the proposal. A considerable amount of effort was put in presenting the proposal and this surely helps with trust.

As the proposer admitted

"It's not possible to measure all the triggered engagement on Catalyst through this campaign, therefore, I have chosen related indicators to measure the success of this campaign:" 

So, from this perspective, I think we can not really measure the efficiency, except:

"Main goal:

Successfully funded proposals: 15 (measured as the referral)"

Yet having "only" 15 as the main goal? I think there are better ideas by budget/outcome. 

2 stars because he is NOT able to effectively assess the feasibility, yet there is a way of referrals - which is unreliable, but it exists. If there would be no referrals, I would assess with 1 star only.
assessments.reply: Once again, Assessor 54 missunderstand how online ads work and also how to measure its effects. You always choose related goals (like views, clicks, etc.) to measure the effectivness of a campaign, which I have clearly pointed out.

assessments.note: Roadmap and milestones seem to be very well defined, the main objective of the project seems to be adequate. The project could have a better explanation of the total hours that will be assigned to each of the project participants.
assessments.reply: "Roadmap and milestones very well defined" and only a score of 3 doesn't match. The planned hours for campaign management are listed. This is a fixed amount for content creation. Going to an agency for the same thing costs about twice the price.

assessments.note: The budget is quite reasonable for the amount of work they intend to get done. They have pointed out all the necessary details and have also taken the time to make a short video pitch.
Very well outlined proposal, with roadmap and important success metrics. They have described what they will do and what kind of impact they expect.

Should the goal on number of submissions (15) not be a little more aggressive? More details on who will be targeted by the marketing campaign would be useful. For instance how are you targeting people who are likely to be proposers?
assessments.reply: I did explain, why I have chosen the goal. Being more "aggressiv"  with the goals is not appropriate.

assessments.note: The plan is detailed and the budget is partitioned. There are clear foals, milestones, timelines and deliverables. Success metrics are defined and the amount of work scoped.

solution: Online Marketing Campaign as a fast and efficient way to attract entrepreneurs to increase diversity and quality of proposals in Catalyst
experience:
10+ years in Marketing

University Degree (Master of Science) in Marketing & Communication

4+ years entrepreneur and business consultant
